When remotely executing a test between two different platforms, where file 
system is different, the default or user-defined ROOTDIR(defined in Artifact 
Properties) for execution can be incorrect. For example, "c:\temp" is a valid 
path on Windows but not linux. If a test is executed on Linux with "c:\temp" 
as ROOTDIR, user will get 2 errors:

1) An internal error occurred 
during: "JUnit1_linux".java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.harness.TestExecutionHarness$1.run
(TestExecutionHarness.java)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:66)

2) IWAT4039E The Test Execution Harness reported the following problems: 
org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException
!STACK 1
org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: IWAT4039E The Test Execution Harness 
reported the following problems: Connection reset by peer: Read failed
	at 
org.eclipse.hyades.test.ui.launch.delegates.AbstractLaunchConfigurationDelegate
2.launch(AbstractLaunchConfigurationDelegate2.java)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch
(LaunchConfiguration.java:569)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin.buildAndLaunch
(DebugUIPlugin.java:788)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin$6.run
(DebugUIPlugin.java:955)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:66)
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.hyades.test.ui 4 0 May 18, 2005 11:34:41.510
!MESSAGE IWAT4039E The Test Execution Harness reported the following problems: 
Connection reset by peer: Read failed

These messages are not very helpful to diagnose the real problem. Better error 
logging should be used.
